00019 /*===========================================================================
00020  * DEFINES
00021  *=========================================================================*/
00022 
00023 /* Resources */
00024 #ifndef cbOS_MAX_NO_OF_PROCS
00025     #define cbOS_MAX_NO_OF_PROCS            ((cb_int32)10)
00026 #endif
00027 
00028 #define cbOS_INVALID_PROCESS_ID         0x0000FFFF
00029 
00030 /* Creation of a process */
00031 #define cbOS_PROCESS_FUNCTION(procFcn) void procFcn(void* cb_UNUSED(dummy))
00032 
00033 /* Accessing a process */
00034 #define cbOS_PROCESS_ID(process) (process##Id)
00035 
00036 /* External process definition. */
00037 #define cbOS_EXTERN_PROCESS(process) extern cbOS_ProcessId process##Id
00038 
00039 #define cbOS_RTSL_DEFAULT_PRIO 30
00040 /*===========================================================================
00041  * TYPES
00042  *=========================================================================*/
00043 typedef void (*cbOS_ProcFcn)(void *pParameter);
00044 
00045 typedef cb_int32 cbOS_ProcessId;
00046 
00047 typedef cb_int32 cbOS_MsgId;
00048 
00049 typedef void (*cbOS_IdleHandler)(void);
00050 
00051 typedef void (*cbOS_SendHandler)(
00052     cbOS_MsgId          msgId,
00053     cbOS_ProcessId      toProcess,
00054     cbOS_ProcessId      fromProcess,
00055     cb_int64            time,
00056     cb_int8             data[]);
00057 
00058 typedef void (*cbOS_ErrorHandler)(
00059     cb_int32            errorCode,
00060     cbOS_ProcessId      processId,
00061     cb_uint32           stackPtr,
00062     const cb_char*      filename,
00063     cb_uint32           line);

00065 /*===========================================================================
00066  * FUNCTIONS
00067  *=========================================================================*/
00068 
00069 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00070  * Initializes the operating system module. Typically called from start 
00071  * handler.
00072  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00073 void cbOS_init(void);
00074 
00075 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076  * cbOS main event handling loop.
00077  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00078 void cbOS_main(void * pParameters);
00079 void cbOS_runOnce();
00080 
00081 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082  * Registers the idle handler. The idle handler is called from the idle 
00083  * process. Does not need to be installed.
00084  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00085 void cbOS_registerIdleHandler(cbOS_IdleHandler idleHandler);
00086 
00087 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00088  * Registers the send handler. The send handler is called every time a 
00089  * message is sent. Does not need to be installed.
00090  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00091 void cbOS_registerSendHandler(cbOS_SendHandler sendHandler);
00092 
00093 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00094  * Registers the error handler. The error handler is called when the EXIT 
00095  * and ASSERT macros are called (see cb_assert.h).
00096  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00097 void cbOS_registerErrorHandler(cbOS_ErrorHandler errorHandler);
00098 
00108 void cbOS_send(cbOS_ProcessId processId, void* pMsg);
00109 
00123 void* cbOS_receive(cbOS_MsgId msgId[], cb_int32 nMsg);
00124 
00125 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00126  * Update the event mask.
00127  * - processId: Identifier of receiving process. Use cbOS_PROCESS_ID macro.
00128  *              E.g. cbOS_PROCESS_ID(SAMPLE_process)
00129  * - events: Bitmask of the events to set.
00130  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00131 void cbOS_setEvents(cbOS_ProcessId processId, cb_uint32 events);
00132 
00133 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00134  * Update the event mask from an interrupt service routing.
00135  * - processId: Identifier of receiving process. Use cbOS_PROCESS_ID macro.
00136  *              E.g. cbOS_PROCESS_ID(SAMPLE_process)
00137  * - events: Bitmask of the events to set.
00138  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00139 void cbOS_setEventsIsr(cbOS_ProcessId processId, cb_uint32 events);
00140 
00141 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00142  * Read the event mask for the current process. 
00143  * Calling this operation will reset the mask. 
00144  * Receives a bit mask of the set events.
00145  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00146 cb_uint32 cbOS_getEvents(void);
00147 
00148 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00149  * Returns the process identifier of the calling process.
00150  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00151 cbOS_ProcessId cbOS_getCurrentProcess(void);
00152 
00159 cbOS_ProcessId cbOS_getSender(void* pMsg);
00160 
00170 cbOS_MsgId cbOS_getMessageId(void* pMsg);

00173  * Check if a buffer with nBytes is available for allocation.
00174  * - nBytes: Number of bytes.
00175  * Returns TRUE if buffer available, otherwise FALSE.
00176  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00177 //TODO remove
00178 cb_boolean cbOS_bufferAvailable(cb_int32 nBytes);

00196  //TODO remove
00197 cb_uint32 cbOS_getAllocMaxSize(void);
